page.title: 10ROADS 1
page.content: KENNFORD IS A STREET VILLAGE, A FINE EXAMPLE OF HOW A ROUTE CAN DICTATE A SITE. IT IS SITUATED ON THE ROUTE OF THE OLD EXETER TO TORQUAY ROAD. THIS WAS BYPASSED IN 1931 AND THIS BYPASS FURTHER BYPASSED IN THE LATE 1970S.THE ROAD USED TO BE THE SCENE OF LONG TRAFFIC QUEUES IN THE 1960S EACH SUMMER SATURDAY AS HOLIDAYMAKERS HEADED FOR HOME USING THE EXETER BYPASS. WITH THE COMING OF THE MOTORWAY TRAFFIC NOW SPEEDS BY AT 70MPH. AT THE BOTTOM OF HALDON HILL , THE A38 HAS AGAIN BEEN BYPASSED LEAVING AN OLD TOLL HOUSE DATING TO AROUND 1870. THE A38 AND THE A380 FORM THE TWO MAJOR HIGHWAYS IN THE AREA CARRYING ALL FORMS OF ROAD TRANSPORT. TRAFFIC IS ALWAYS HEAVIEST IN THE SUMMER WHEN THE TOURIST INDUSTRY IS IN FULL SWING.
